_comment: Created by ianb on 03/10/2013 16:38:59 using v0.9
title: How have breaches of the four hour target changed since 2003?
analysis_commentary: The percentage of people waiting more than four hours for their treatment to be completed in A&E fell dramatically before and after the introduction of the target in January 2004, although it was over a year until the target was finally achieved. It is also notable that the target was not achieved consistently, with winter months often breaching but still under 4%. The relaxation of the target to 5% in 2010 was associated with an increase in patients waiting more than four hours, but performance was in line with the new target. Performance was maintained at the 95% level until September 2012, when it began to drop. By April 2013, achievement had fallen to just 90% - the lowest level since the introduction of the four hour target in January 2004. Since May 2013, the proportion of people waiting in A&E for four hours or less has returned to around the 95% level.
data_source: NHS England, A&E Waiting Times and Activity
